page.title: 15Distington Engineering Co
page.content: DEC is the{iron and steel}contracting arm for the British Steel Corporation. Locally, it is known as 'Chapel Bank' because of its close proximity to Chapel Hill on which was built the first church in Workington. DEC was once a major{foundry}and{engineering complex serving many parts of the world. In the last decade the foundry has been remodelled and the engineering section scaled down, resulting in a significant loss of jobs. Today, the works using Concast Technology supplies castings for water treatment plants, slab cooling, roller tables and inspection equipment. The engineering section construct {nuclear transportation flasks}for carrying nuclear waste to and from British Nuclear Fuels at Windscales in Cumbria.
